function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application now shows the checkout page, which includes a detailed cart summary of two 'Galaxy S10 5G' units, and a multi-section checkout form. The form is divided into customer information, address details, and payment options. There's a 'Submit' button at the end of the form. The payment options include Invoice, Credit Card, and PayPal. The navigation bar and a cart overlay are still accessible.","new_testing_goal":"Complete the checkout form with customer information, address, and payment details, and submit it to test the form validation and submission process.","explanation":"Fill out the customer information section, address details, and choose a payment option from the dropdown menu. Complete the process by clicking on the 'Submit' button. This will test the form's validation mechanisms and the submission process, ensuring that the checkout functions properly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"send_keys","element_id":":rp:","keys":"John"}}

messages.content: Given a web application, you are tasked with assisting in testing its functionality. The emulate_interaction function takes an interaction as input and emulates it on the web application. The return value of the function is the new, filtered HTML source code of the web application. The source code of previous interactions will be omitted from the input to the assistant.
Here are some examples how the 'emulate_interaction' function should be used.
Please test my website: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description": "The start page of a web site with multiple calculators for different purposes. There are buttons to navigate to the differet calculators and a button to switch the language of the web site. The current language is English.", "new_testing_goal": "Test the calculator for calculating the area of a circle in multiple languages.", "explanation": "First navigate to the calculator for the area of a circle. Then input a radius and calculate the area. Switch the language of the web site and repeat the process.", "interaction": {"interaction_type": "click", "element_id": "btn-area-circle"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The web application is now displaying a detailed cart overlay on an e-commerce platform for Samsung Galaxy S10 models. The cart contains the 'Galaxy S10 5G' with a quantity of 2 and provides options to either remove the item, adjust its quantity, clear the entire cart, or proceed to checkout. The total cost in the cart reflects the price of two 'Galaxy S10 5G' models. The rest of the page includes a navigation bar with links to various product categories (Galaxy, S10, M Series, A Series) and a 'Shop Now' button that redirects to the Galaxy category. Additionally, the main content area still shows the product listings for the S10 series, with options to add each model to the cart.","new_testing_goal":"Navigate to the 'A Series' product category to explore and test product listings within that category.","explanation":"Close the cart overlay to return focus to the main content area. Then, navigate to the 'A Series' product category through the navigation bar to observe and test the functionality and listing of products within that category. This step is critical for assessing the site's navigation efficiency and the proper display of product listings in different categories.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r9:"}}

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is currently displaying a detailed cart overlay on the Samsung Galaxy S10 series e-commerce platform. The cart contains the 'Galaxy S10 5G' with quantity of 2, along with options to modify the item quantity, remove items, clear the cart, or proceed to checkout. The webpage also includes a navigational bar with links to product categories such as Galaxy, S10, M Series, and A Series. The main area of the website lists the Galaxy S10 series models with add-to-cart options for each, except for the 'Galaxy S10 5G' which is already in the user's cart. The website aims to provide customers with an easy way to purchase Samsung Galaxy products.","new_testing_goal":"Navigate to and test the checkout process to ensure it handles the cart contents correctly and processes transactions as expected.","explanation":"Close the cart overlay and click the cart icon to proceed to the detailed cart view with the intention of navigating to the checkout process. This step is to test and ensure that the checkout process handles the items in the cart correctly, processes transactions without issues, and provides confirmation upon completion.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r2:"}}

messages.content: omitted

function_call.name: emulate_interaction
function_call.arguments: {"page_description":"The website is displaying a detailed view of a shopping cart containing two units of the 'Galaxy S10 5G' model, showing options for adjusting quantity, removing items, clearing the cart, and proceeding to checkout. The total price reflects the cost of two units. The navigation bar includes links to various product categories. The rest of the page lists Galaxy S10 models with their 'add to cart' options. A cart overlay is visible, emphasizing the cart's content and available actions.","new_testing_goal":"Proceed to checkout and test the checkout functionality, including form submission and payment processing if available.","explanation":"Click the 'Checkout' button to navigate to the checkout page. There, fill out any necessary forms, select a payment method if available, and finalize the checkout process to ensure it handles cart contents correctly and processes transactions smoothly.","interaction":{"interaction_type":"click","element_id":":r7:"}}

The user provided the following end instructions: Please test my website. The goal is to test as many different features as possible to find potential bugs, so make sure to include edge cases.
Pursue your self-assigned sub-goal or assign a new one: Proceed to checkout and test the checkout functionality, including form submission and payment processing if available..

Previously executed interactions by goal: {"Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each product to ensure it updates the cart correctly.": 3, "Test the removal of an item from the cart and the clear cart functionality to ensure they work correctly.": 1, "Test the checkout process to ensure it functions correctly and handles the cart contents as expected.": 1, "Verify the functionality of adjusting the quantity of items in the cart, and testing the checkout process.": 1, "Verify the functionality of removing an item from the cart, clearing the cart, and navigating to different product categories.": 1, "Navigate to the Galaxy S10 product category to test product listings and add-to-cart functionality for each model.": 1, "Test the 'add to cart' functionality for each S10 model and verify the cart updates accordingly.": 1, "Test the cart functionality further by adjusting the quantity of items, then proceed to checkout, and also navigate through different product categories to inspect if product listings update accordingly.": 1, "Navigate to the 'A Series' product category to explore and test product listings within that category.": 1, "Navigate to and test the checkout process to ensure it handles the cart contents correctly and processes transactions as expected.": 1, "Proceed to checkout and test the checkout functionality, including form submission and payment processing if available.": 1}.

Start by describing the website supplied by the function call. Give a short general description first then summarize the main elements on the website. Do not use HTML in your description. Then you may formulate a high level sub-goal to the user's instructions, that should be persued with the next couple of interactions. You should formulate a new sub-goal if the current one has been completed or seems to be unattainable. Give an action plan that explains how the goal should be reached. And finally, describe the interaction to emulate.

Only use the click action with clickable elements. The clickable elements have the following ids: :rl:, :r1:, :r2:, :rm:, :rn:, :ro:. Only use the send_keys action with writable elements. The writable elements have the following ids: :rp:, :rq:, :rr:, :rs:, :rt:, :ru:, :rv:, :r10:.

functions.name: emulate_interaction
functions.description: Emulates a user interaction with the web application

page_description.description: A short textual description of the state of the web application: What is the current page? What are the main elements on the page? This description should not contain any HTML.

new_testing_goal.description: Assigns a new high level sub-goal that shall be followed in order to complete the users instructions. This goal should take multiple user interactions to complete. The assistant shall try to complete this goal in the next couple of interactions and then assign a new one.

explanation.description: An action plan that explains how the goal should be reached.

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

interaction_type.description: The type of interaction to emulate

element_id.description: The id of the element to interact with

keys.description: the keys to be sent to the input element

anyOf.description: sends keystrokes to an html element
